{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2014}} {{Confusing|date=October 2015}}
'''Additionality''' is the property of an activity being additional. It is a determination of whether an intervention has an effect, when the intervention is compared to a baseline. 'Interventions' can take a variety of forms, but often include economic incentives.<ref>{{cite web|last=Gillenwater, M.|title=What is Additionality? Part 1: A long standing problem|url=http://ghginstitute.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/AdditionalityPaper_Part-1ver3FINAL.pdf|accessdate=10 December 2014}}</ref> For an example of the application of additionality in environmental crediting markets refer to [[Carbon_credit#Additionality_and_its_importance|carbon credits]].
Additionality may be evaluated ex post, as is often done in the practice of [[program evaluation]]. Or it can be done ex ante, as an initial eligibility screen for issuing credits as part of an environmental or other [[Public_good|public goods]] market. For ex ante applications, additionality is evaluated for proposed activities. A proposed activity is additional if the recognized interventions are deemed to be causing the activity to take place. The occurrence of additionality is determined by assessing whether a proposed activity is distinct from its baseline. A baseline is a prediction of the quantified amount of an input to or output from an activity resulting from the expected future behavior of the actors proposing, and affected by, the proposed activity in the absence of one or more policy interventions, holding all other factors constant (ceteris paribus).<ref>{{cite web|last=Gillenwater, M. |title=What Is Additionality? Part 2: A framework for a more precise definitions and standardized approaches |url=http://ghginstitute.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/AdditionalityPaper_Part-2ver3FINAL.pdf |accessdate=10 December 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140821171316/http://ghginstitute.org/wp-content/uploads/content/GHGMI/AdditionalityPaper_Part-2%28ver3%29FINAL.pdf |archivedate=21 August 2014 |df=dmy }}</ref>
Other working definitions of the term are available [http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/additionality here].
==Economic definition==
Net positive difference that results from economic development intervention. The extent to which an activity (and associated outputs, outcomes and impacts) is larger in scale, at a higher quality, takes place more quickly, takes place at a different location, or takes place at all as a result of intervention. Additionality measures the net result, taking account of deadweight, leakage, displacement, substitution and economic multipliers.<ref>{{cite web|last=Appraisal & Evaluation Team|title=Additionality & Economic Impact Assessment Guidance Note: A Summary Guide to Assessing the Additional Benefit, or Additionality, of an Economic Development Project or Programme|url=http://www.scottish-enterprise.com/~/media/SE/Resources/Documents/ABC/additionality-and-economic-impact-assessment-guidance.ashx|publisher=Scottish Enterprise|accessdate=21 July 2012}}</ref>
Additionality is calculated by the following formula:<ref>{{cite web|title=Additionality Guide: A Standard Approach to Assessing the Additional Impact of Projects|url=http://www.proveandimprove.org/documents/AdditionalityGuide.pdf|publisher=English Partnerships|accessdate=21 July 2012}}</ref>
{{math|''A'' {{=}} ''I''<sub>in</sub> − ''I''<sub>rc</sub>}}
where ''A'' is the additionality, ''I''<sub>in</sub> is the impact of the intervention, and ''I''<sub>rc</sub> is the impact of a reference case.
==Problems==
[[Clean_Development_Mechanism#The_risk_of_fraud|Additionality becomes problematic]] when the parties claim that their behavior is being changed due to recognized intervention (e.g., because of the economic incentive provided by earning carbon offset credits), when in fact the intervention is having no effect on their behavior because other factors are dominant (e.g., earning a profit from an activity even without carbon credits). The proposed project is therefore not truly ''additional'', since it would have been implemented without the intervention (e.g., in the form of the carbon credit price signal). This without intervention scenario is often referred to as "[[Business as usual (business)|business as usual]]").
==See also==
* [[Clean Development Mechanism]] – additional climate mitigation measures as defined under the [[Kyoto Protocol]] * [[Value added]]
==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}}
== External links ==
* [http://ghginstitute.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/AdditionalityPaper_Part-1ver3FINAL.pdf What is Additionality? Part 1: A long standing problem, GHG Management Institute, Discussion Paper No. 001, (Jan 2012).] * [http://ghginstitute.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/AdditionalityPaper_Part-2ver3FINAL.pdf What Is Additionality? Part 2: A framework for a more precise definitions and standardized approaches, GHG Management Institute, Discussion Paper No. 002, (Jan 2012).] * [http://ghginstitute.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/AdditionalityPaper_Part-3ver3FINAL.pdf What Is Additionality? Part 3: Implications for stacking and unbundling, GHG Management Institute, Discussion Paper No. 003, (Jan 2012).]

{{long plot|date=August 2016}} {{Infobox video game | title = Bravely Second: End Layer | image = BravelySecond.jpg{{!}}border | developer = [[Silicon Studio]] | publisher = {{Video game release|JP|Square Enix|WW|Nintendo}} | director = Kensuke Nakahara | producer = Tomoya Asano | designer = | programmer = | artist = [[Akihiko Yoshida]] | writer = Tomoya Asano
Shinji Takahashi
Souki Tsukishima | composer = [[Supercell (band)|Ryo]] | platforms = [[Nintendo 3DS]] | released = {{Video game release|JP|April 23, 2015|EU|February 26, 2016{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/nintendouk/status/674876533761318912|title=Return to Luxendarc for new adventures in Bravely Second: End Layer on Nintendo #3DS, coming to Europe on 26/02/2016|publisher=NintendoUK|date=December 10, 2015|accessdate=December 10, 2015}}|AU|February 27, 2016|NA|April 15, 2016{{cite web|url=http://www.novacrystallis.com/2016/01/bravely-second-coming-to-north-america-in-april-2016/|title=Bravely Second coming to North America in April, Collector’s Edition announced|first=Red|last=Makuzawa|work=Nova Crystallis|date=January 19, 2016|accessdate=January 19, 2016}}}} | genre = [[Role-playing video game|Role-playing]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }} {{nihongo|'''''Bravely Second: End Layer'''''|ブレイブリーセカンド エンドレイヤー|Bureiburī Sekando: Endo Reiyā|lead=yes}}{{cite web|url=http://www.inside-games.jp/article/2015/02/09/84889.html|title=『ブレイブリーセカンド』正式タイトルが『BSEL』に決定！"エンドレイヤー"に隠された謎とは|work=インサイド}} is a [[Japan]]ese [[role-playing video game]] developed by [[Silicon Studio]] and published by [[Square Enix]] for the [[Nintendo 3DS]], and is the sequel to ''[[Bravely Default]]''. It was released by Square Enix in Japan on April 23, 2015, and by [[Nintendo]] in North America, Europe, and Australia in 2016.{{cite web |url=http://www.siliconera.com/2015/06/01/bravely-second-coming-west-in-2016/ |title=Bravely Second Coming West In 2016 |author=Ishaan |date=2015-06-01 |publisher=Siliconera |access-date=2015-06-06}}{{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/NintendoAUNZ/status/606988888847077378 |title=Nintendo AU NZ on Twitter |author=[[Nintendo]] |date=2015-06-05 |publisher=[[Twitter]] |access-date=2015-06-06}} ==Gameplay== Bravely Second is a traditional [[role-playing video game]] with turn-based action, and reuses the battle system of its predecessor ''[[Bravely Default]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.polygon.com/2013/12/4/5174778/bravely-second-3ds-bravely-default-sequel |title=Bravely Second is a 3DS sequel to Bravely Default |last=Tach |first=David |publisher=Polygon |date=2013-10-24 |accessdate=2013-12-04}} This allows players to build up "brave points" (BP), or the amount of user turns per character at any given time. On any turn, characters can "default", to guard, and gain an additional BP, or "brave" multiple times, to use up BP and act multiple times on the same turn. New to the game is a chain-battle feature where a player who defeats a random encounter may continue to battle enemies in succession for greater risk and reward.{{cite web | url=http://uk.ign.com/wikis/bravely-second/Leveling_and_Grinding_Guide | title=Levelling and Grinding Guide - IGN | publisher=IGN | accessdate=October 18, 2017}} Players can receive up to three times the amount of experience; and money. This also allows the player to level up each character's "Job Points" (JP). Each character has access to many different jobs, (up to a total of 30) by gaining that job's asterisk.{{cite web | url=http://bravelysecond.nintendo.com/job-system/ | title=Job System - Bravely Second | publisher=Nintendo | accessdate=October 18, 2017}} The asterisk is usually held by another character in gameworld with that class. [[Bravely Default]]'s sidequests have been revamped; players encounter two Eternian asterisk holders in an argument about an ethical dilemma, and the player must resolve the conflict with the reward being the loser's asterisk.{{cite web | url=http://www.siliconera.com/2016/04/18/bravely-seconds-job-options-overshadow-sidequests-difficult-decisions/ | title=Bravely Seconds Job Options | publisher=Silicon Era | accessdate=October 18, 2017}} ==Story== Two and a half years after the events of ''Bravely Default,''{{cite web |url=http://kotaku.com/first-look-at-bravely-second-the-totally-new-bravely-d-1476290194 |title=First Look at Bravely Second, the Totally New Bravely Default Sequel |last=Ashcraft |first=Kevin |publisher=Kotaku |date=2012-12-04 |accessdate=2013-12-04}}{{cite web|url=http://gematsu.com/2013/12/bravely-default-sequel-announced-for-3ds |title=Bravely Default sequel announced for 3DS |last=Romano |first=Sal |publisher=Gematsu |date=2013-09-12 |accessdate=2013-12-04}} Agnès Oblige has been elected the Pope of the Crystal Orthodoxy. She and Grand Marshal Braev Lee of the Duchy of Eternia seek to end hostilities between their groups with a formal peace treaty in the city of Gathelatio. The ceremony is interrupted by Kaiser Oblivion, leader of the Glanz Empire, and his cryst-fairy companion Anne, who abduct Agnès and imprison her in their floating fortress, the Skyhold. Yew Geneolgia, leader of Agnès' Crystalguard protectors, awakens a week after the attack and sets out to rescue her with fellow Crystalguard leaders Janne Engarde and Nikolai Nikolanikov. However, Janne and Nikolai are revealed to be moles for the Empire. Later guided by Agnès through a crystal shard she dropped when she was kidnapped, Yew assembles three companions: Eternian Ducal Guard captain Edea Lee, the daughter of Braev who aided Agnès in their first adventure,{{cite web |url=http://www.siliconera.com/2015/01/20/edea-will-one-main-characters-bravely-second/ |title=Edea Will Be One Of The Main Characters In Bravely Second |author=Sato |publisher=Siliconera |date=2015-01-20 |accessdate=2015-01-22}} Magnolia Arch, a young Ba'al Buster from the moon who is the sole survivor of an attack on her village and possesses an hourglass capable of localized time manipulation, and Tiz Arrior, a former comrade of Agnès and Edea who has been comatose for the past two and a half years. The group is unable to prevent the Kaiser from escaping in the Skyhold. With the guidance of both Agnès and a mysterious "man with a purple pen", the party pursues the Skyhold across the world. During their travels, the Kaiser obtains a compass of space and time. The party also learns about the Sword of the Brave, a cursed sword that took Yew's older half-brother Denys' right arm after he tried to claim it; he was disinherited and vanished soon after. At the Fire Temple in Eisenberg, following their encounter with the mysterious Kyubi, the group find the Fire Crystal has been overcharged and realize that the Kaiser is summoning the Holy Pillar. The group hurries to Florem to intercept the Empire at the Water Crystal, where the man with the purple pen reveals himself to be a Celestial Being named Altair who has possessed Tiz since his near-death at the Great Chasm two years prior. Meanwhile, the Kaiser forces Agnès to dispel the shield around the Water Crystal and overcharge it to summon the Holy Pillar. The party attacks the Skyhold and kills Janne and Nikolai, both revealed to oppose the Orthodoxy due to its past corruption. Their deaths buy time for the Kaiser to use the compass to travel back in time with Agnès, but Anne has already sabotaged the compass to send the two to the distant future as she uses the Holy Pillar's power to destroy the Moon. The party defeats Anne in battle, but the destruction of the Moon ceases the flow of time and places the world in a state that would eventually end in inevitable destruction. The party uses Magnolia's hourglass to go back in time to the peace ceremony and stop the Kaiser from abducting Agnès, learning his true identity is Yew's missing brother Denys. Denys escapes with the aid of Janne and Nikolai, but the party utilizes their memories of the previous timeline to stop Denys' plans while convincing his subordinates not to throw their lives away. Yew eventually corners Denys in the Geneolgia crypts, learning his brother's intent to use the compass to travel back in time to kill their family's founder to negate the corrupt misdeeds caused by their bloodline. Yew defeats Denys, and Agnès and Braev convince him to own up to his mistakes and create a world of peace in the present. However, Anne forces a Vestling to manifest the Holy Pillar to destroy the moon once again before Denys destroys her brooch. Anne responds by awakening Diamante, the Ba'al that ravaged Magnolia's home and concealed itself as the Skyhold, to destroy the group. Denys sacrifices himself by using the compass to send himself and Diamante to the end of time. The party awakens in Caldisla, which Kyubi had displaced prior, and confront Anne when she attempts to use Norende's Great Chasm to summon Ba'als directly to Luxendarc. She reveals she is the older sister of Tiz and Edea's old enemy Airy; she manipulated them into defeating Airy as the intrusion of her "god" Ouroboros would pose a threat to her master Providence, the so-called "god" of the Celestial Realm. Anne explains that Providence created the Ba'als using the memories of Altair's lover Vega. After killing Anne, the group enters the Celestial Realm and frees Vega from Providence's control. After Altair and Vega depart in peace, the group is attacked by Providence, who [[Fourth wall|breaks the fourth wall and attempts to delete the player's save file]]. The party stops Providence and destroys him. When the group returns to Luxendarc, Tiz is revealed to be dying again now that Altair's soul has left him. A mysterious Adventurer, who has provided aid to Tiz since Norende's destruction, appears and takes Magnolia's hourglass back in time to give to Tiz at the start of his original adventure. The Adventurer, revealing herself to be a colleague of Altair's named Deneb, returns and informs the group that the hourglass, now with two and a half years' worth of hopes and dreams, will be able to renew his life. Agnès, possessing the hourglass, delivers it to the party and revives Tiz. In the game's epilogue, Agnès retires from her duties as the pope and settles down in Norende with Tiz while Edea sets out as the new Grand Marshall to secure the peace between Eternia and the Orthodoxy. Magnolia decides to remain on Luxendarc with Yew, and the two confess their love for each other. In a post-credits scene, having interacted with the party under the guise of their world's Alternis Dim in their dealings with Kyubi and the Empire, Tiz and Edea's old companion Ringabel is revealed to have become an agent of an interdimensional police force called the Planeswardens. He gives the Planeswardens confirmation that the Sword of the Brave exists. ==Development== As early as December 2012, talks of a sequel to ''Bravely Default'' arose, with producer Tomoya Asano requesting feedback from fans to be used for a sequel to the game.{{cite web|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2012/12/17/bravely-default-sequel-in-the-works-producer-asking-for-fan-feedback/ |title=Bravely Default Sequel In The Works |author=Sato |publisher=Siliconera |date=2012-12-17 |accessdate=2013-12-04}} Talks of a sequel also arose again in June 2013, when game developer [[Yasumi Matsuno]] announced that character designer and lead artist [[Akihiko Yoshida]] was working on a ''Bravely Default'' sequel.{{cite web|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2013/06/05/akihiko-yoshida-working-on-next-bravely-default-says-yasumi-matsuno/ |title=Akihiko Yoshida Working On Next Bravely Default Says Yasumi Matsuno |author=Ishaan |publisher=Siliconera |date=2013-06-05 |accessdate=2013-12-04}} In August 2013, Square Enix announced ''Bravely Default: For the Sequel'', an updated version of the original that would implement new gameplay ideas developed for a sequel in the series.{{cite web|url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/441296/bravely-default-sequel-announced-for-3ds/ |title=News: Bravely Default sequel announced for 3DS |last=Hussain |first=Tamoor |publisher=ComputerAndVideoGames |date=2012-12-04 |accessdate=2013-12-04|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141210224726/http://www.computerandvideogames.com/441296/bravely-default-sequel-announced-for-3ds/|archivedate=2014-12-10}}{{cite web|url=http://www.destructoid.com/bravely-default-for-the-sequel-expansion-announced-260894.phtml |title=Bravely Default For the Sequel expansion announced |last=North |first=Dale |publisher=Destructoid |date=2013-08-28 |accessdate=2013-12-04}} The name ''Bravely Second'' was trademarked as early as September 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2013/09/18/hey-these-trademarks-sound-like-future-bravely-default-games/ |title=Hey, These Trademarks Sound Like Future Bravely Default Games |author=Ishaan |publisher=Siliconera |date=2013-09-18 |accessdate=2013-12-04}} The game's name was officially announced as ''Bravely Second'' in a December 2013 issue of ''[[Jump (magazine line)|Jump]]'' magazine.{{cite web|last=Phillips |first=Tom |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2013-12-04-bravely-default-sequel-announced-for-3ds-in-japan |title=Bravely Default sequel announced for 3DS in Japan • News • 3DS • |publisher=Eurogamer |date= |accessdate=2013-12-04}} being named after a gameplay mechanic from ''Bravely Default: For the Sequel''.{{cite web|url=http://www.vg247.com/2013/12/04/bravely-second-announced-as-sequel-to-bravely-default/ |title=Bravely Second announced as sequel to Bravely Default |last=Nunneley |first=Stephany |publisher=VG247 |date=2013-12-04 |accessdate=2013-12-04}} Upon announcement, the game's only announced platform is the [[Nintendo 3DS]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nintendolife.com/news/2013/12/bravely_default_sequel_confirmed_for_3ds_in_japan |title=Bravely Default Sequel Confirmed for 3DS in Japan |last=Whitehead |first=Thomas |publisher=Nintendolife |date=2012-12-04 |accessdate=2013-12-04}} The game was approximately 30% complete around the time of its official announcement. In December 2013, it was revealed that Yoshida had left Square Enix.{{cite web |url=http://www.polygon.com/2013/12/5/5177724/bravely-default-character-designer-leaves-square-enix |title=Bravely Default character designer leaves Square Enix |author=Gera, Emily |publisher=[[Polygon (website)|Polygon]] |date=2013-12-05 |accessdate=2013-12-05}} Despite this, he states he still plans on continuing to work on the ''Bravely'' games, and ''Bravely Second'' will still retain the same [[anime]] art style established in the first game. albeit with characters having slightly more realistic proportions, being slightly less [[chibi (term)|chibi]].{{cite web |author=Ishaan |url=http://www.siliconera.com/2013/12/10/bravely-second-will-larger-fields-things/ |title=Bravely Second Will Have Larger Fields, More Things To Do |publisher=Siliconera |date=2013-12-10 |accessdate=2013-12-14}} Initial brainstorming led to ideas such as having Magnolia wear a space suit or bunny ears, but this was ultimately scrapped to pursue a more "adult look", something the developers felt was missing in the first title.{{cite web |author=Sato |url=http://www.siliconera.com/2013/12/12/bravely-second-producer-aims-create-new-pillar-support-square-enix/ |title=Bravely Second Producer Aims To Create A New Pillar Of Support For Square Enix |publisher=Siliconera |date= |accessdate=2013-12-14}} Asano also confirmed that the game will stay story driven as opposed to exploration driven, as with the first game.{{cite web|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2014/02/21/bravely-second-will-focus-story-rather-exploration/|title=Bravely Second Will Focus On Story Rather Than Exploration|author=Ishaan|publisher=Siliconera|date=2014-02-21|accessdate=2014-02-22}} In April 2014, producer Tomoya Asano announced in ''Famitsu''{{'}}s Rumour Column that the scenario for the game was completed.{{cite web |author=Mauro Piccillo |url=http://www.eirgames.com/13580/bravely-second-scenario-completato/ |title=Bravely Second Scenario Compleato!|publisher=EIR Games |date= |accessdate=2014-04-12}} In late July 2014, [[Famitsu]] magazine revealed that [[Sound Horizon|Revo]] would not be returning to compose the soundtrack for the game due to conflicting schedules, and that Ryo from the band [[Supercell (band)|Supercell]] would be taking his place.{{cite web|last1=Sato|title=Supercell’s ryo In Charge Of Music For Bravely Second|url=http://www.siliconera.com/2014/07/29/supercells-ryo-charge-music-bravely-second/|website=Siliconera|accessdate=2014-07-29}} On December 10, 2014, a trial version of the game was released on the Japanese Nintendo eShop.{{cite web|url=http://www.jp.square-enix.com/second/trial/|title=無料で遊べる三銃士編｜ブレイブリーセカンド｜SQUARE ENIX|author=SQUARE ENIX CO., LTD.|work=ブレイブリーセカンド｜SQUARE ENIX}} A [[Game demo|demo]] was released ahead of the game's full release, by Nintendo E-Shop download only, and contained content not present in the final game. The demo, released as ''Bravely Second: The Ballad of the Three Cavaliers'', allowed players to sample ten classes, as well as ten or more hours of gameplay. Some items that were collected in the demo can transfer into the main game.{{cite web | url=http://www.gamesradar.com/bravely-second-demo-will-be-essential-playing-fans/ | title=Bravely Second: Demo will be essential playing | publisher=Games Radar | date=January 20, 2016 | accessdate=October 18, 2017}} == Reception == {{Video game reviews | MC = 81/100{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/3ds/bravely-second-end-layer |title=Bravely Second: End Layer for 3DS Reviews |website=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=2018-08-08}} | Fam = 36 of 40 (9/9/9/9) }} ''Bravely Second'' received positive reviews. Praise went towards the gameplay following on from the original game, and criticism went mostly towards the story and lack of differentiation from its predecessor. In their review, ''[[Famitsu]]'' gave the game the score 36 of 40, consisting of the sub-scores 9, 9, 9, and 9.{{cite web |url=http://nintendoeverything.com/famitsu-review-scores-41415-bravely-second/ |title=Famitsu review scores (4/14/15) – Bravely Second |author=Brian |publisher=Nintendo Everything |date=April 14, 2015 |accessdate=April 15, 2015}} Siliconera detailed and translated a series of responses from Japanese players including praise for the "Consecutive Chance" feature and criticism for overuse of [[Internet meme|memes]] and modern linguistics drawing comparisons to ''[[Hyperdimension Neptunia]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.siliconera.com/2015/04/30/japanese-players-are-enjoying-bravely-second-but-point-out-some-of-its-flaws/|title=Japanese Players Are Enjoying Bravely Second, But Point Out Some Of Its Flaws|author=Sato |publisher=Siliconera |date=April 30, 2015 |accessdate=March 22, 2016}} Janine Hawkins from ''Polygon'' criticized the lack of innovation from its predecessor but praised the world and the writing, saying "The world is beautifully realized, and the writing is enjoyable"; Hawkins summarized her review as "Bravely Second takes after its predecessor almost to a fault."{{Cite web|url=http://www.polygon.com/2016/4/25/11485494/bravely-second-end-layer-review-3ds|title=Bravely Second: End Layer review|last=Hawkins|first=Janine|date=2016-04-25|website=Polygon|access-date=2016-05-14}} Mike Mahardy from ''Gamespot'' said "One could argue it feels more like an exceptional expansion than a true sequel" citing how "the combat, despite its sleek design, doesn't make any major improvements on the well established formula." Criticizing the writing, he adds "But in the end, Bravely Second transcends the limitations that its poor writing and redundant storyline create."{{Cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/reviews/bravely-second-end-layer-review/1900-6416406/|title=Bravely Second: End Layer Review|website=GameSpot|access-date=2016-05-14}} === Sales === ''Bravely Second'' was the best selling video game in Japan during its debut week, with 100,047 copies sold and 53.6% of the initial shipment sold out.{{cite web |url=http://www.siliconera.com/2015/04/29/week-sales-bravely-second-job/ |title=This Week In Sales: Bravely Second Is On The Job |author=Ishaan |date=April 29, 2015 |publisher=Siliconera |access-date=May 2, 2015}} This was a lower debut than that of the original ''Bravely Default''; during its launch week, 141,529 copies were sold, which corresponded to 85.68% of its first shipment.{{cite web |url=http://www.siliconera.com/2015/05/01/bravely-second-sold-through-54-of-its-shipment/ |title=Bravely Second Sold Through 54% Of Its Shipment |author=Ishaan |date=May 1, 2015 |publisher=Siliconera |access-date=May 2, 2015}} By April 2017, 700,000 copies had been sold worldwide.{{cite web|url=http://nintendoeverything.com/bravely-second-end-layer-has-sold-700000-copies-worldwide/|title=Bravely Second: End Layer has sold 700,000 copies worldwide|website=Nintendo Everything|accessdate=April 22, 2017}} In North America, the game was the ninth best-selling game of its debut month of April 2016, a feat deemed particularly impressive by [[VentureBeat]], which noted was rare for a physical release of a niche genre like a [[JRPG]].https://venturebeat.com/2016/05/12/nintendos-star-fox-and-bravely-second-rank-among-aprils-best-selling-console-games/ In the United Kingdom, the game debuted at #12 on the All-Formats chart and #9 on the individual format chart that ranks the releases of multi-platform games per console as opposed to title. During its debut week, it was the highest selling game on a Nintendo platform.{{cite web |url=http://tanukibridge.com/2016/02/29/bravely-second-has-strong-uk-chart-debut/ |title=Bravely Second Has Strong UK Chart Debut|author=Josh A. Stevens |date=February 29, 2016 |publisher=Tanuki Bridge |access-date=May 28, 2016}}{{cite web |url=http://www.nintendolife.com/news/2016/02/bravely_second_end_layer_secures_a_decent_start_in_the_uk_charts |title=Bravely Second: End Layer Secures a Decent Start in the UK Charts|author=Thomas Whitehead |date=February 29, 2016 |publisher=Nintendo Life |access-date=May 28, 2016}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== * [http://bravelysecond.nintendo.com/ Official website] {{Final Fantasy series}} {{Portal bar|Video games|2010s}} [[Category:2015 video games]] [[Category:Nintendo 3DS games]] [[Category:Nintendo 3DS-only games]] [[Category:Nintendo 3DS eShop games]] [[Category:Nintendo Network games]] [[Category:Role-playing video games]] [[Category:Fantasy video games]] [[Category:Nintendo games]] [[Category:Square Enix games]] [[Category:Video game sequels]] [[Category:Video games developed in Japan]] [[Category:Fiction about religion]]

{{Infobox ethnic group |group=Brazilians in Suriname |image = |caption = |population = 40,000 |regions= [[Albina, Suriname|Albina]]{{·}}[[Paramaribo]] |langs= [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]]{{·}}[[Sranan Tongo]] |rels= [[Roman Catholicism]] |related= [[Brazilian diaspora]] }} '''Brazilians in Suriname''' form a large community consisting mostly of miners. The number of Brazilians in the country is estimated at 40,000, nearly 10 percent of the population.<ref>"[https://www.nytimes.com/2000/03/30/business/guyana-caught-brazil-s-net-small-nation-new-free-markets-fears-loss-its-identity.html Guyana: Caught in Brazil's Net?; Small Nation, New to Free Markets, Fears Loss of Its Identity]", ''The New York Times'', 30 March 2000.</ref> Suriname allegedly has the largest community of Brazilians in any [[CARICOM]] nation.<ref>"[http://www.caribarena.com/dominica/caribbean/suriname/5232-suriname-south-american-neighbours-sign-cooperation-agreements.html Suriname- South American Neighbours Sign Cooperation Agreements]{{dead link|date=November 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}", ''Caribarena Dominica'', 13 September 2009.</ref>
==Settlement== [[Suriname]]'s low population density and abundant natural resources have attracted numerous migrants from neighboring [[Brazil]].<ref>"[http://geocurrents.info/place/latin-america/ethnic-rioting-in-suriname Ethnic Rioting in Suriname]", ''Geo Currents'', 30 December 2009.</ref> Over the past decade or so, as many as 40,000 Brazilians, mostly illegal immigrants, have moved to Suriname, a country with fewer than half a million citizens. Many if not most Brazilians in Suriname work as small-scale gold miners in the town of [[Albina, Suriname|Albina]] which has become primarily a base for nomadic gold prospectors.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Elizondo |first1=Gabriel |title =Christmas violence in Suriname | url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/americas/2009/12/27/christmas-violence-suriname | accessdate =December 27, 2009 | date =December 27, 2009 | publisher=[[Al Jazeera]]}}</ref>
==Albina riots== {{Further|2009 Albina, Suriname riots}} Gold mining in Albina is typically environmentally destructive and it often results in clashes between the miners and indigenous peoples.
In late December 2009, [[2009 Albina, Suriname riots|a series of riots occurred]] when local [[maroon (people)|maroon]] inhabitants attacked [[Brazilian people|Brazilian]], [[Chinese people|Chinese]], [[Colombia]]n and [[Peruvian]] [[gold]] [[:wikt:digger|digger]]s after a man was allegedly stabbed to death by a Brazilian.<ref name="Conflito no Suriname levou a pelo menos 7 mortes, diz missionário">{{cite web | title =Conflito no Suriname levou a pelo menos 7 mortes, diz missionário|url=http://g1.globo.com/Noticias/Mundo/0,,MUL1427214-5602,00-CONFLITO+NO+SURINAME+LEVOU+A+PELO+MENOS+MORTES+DIZ+MISSIONARIO.html | accessdate =December 27, 2009 | date =December 26, 2009 | publisher=G1 Globo.com|language=Portuguese}}</ref> The Brazilian government sent a diplomatic mission on December 27, 2009 to attend the Brazilian victims.<ref name="Brasil envia missão diplomática ao Suriname para atender brasileiros atacados">{{cite web | title =Brasil envia missão diplomática ao Suriname para atender brasileiros atacados|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/epa/article/ALeqM5j0_c3QTCfaZAYaxn_v786ibOkosg | accessdate =December 27, 2009|date =December 27, 2009 | publisher=Google|language=Portuguese}}</ref> Five Brazilians returned to Brazil on December 27 on an airplane of the [[Brazilian Air Force]].<ref name="Suriname: detidos 35 suspeitos de agredir brasileiros">{{cite web |title=Suriname: detidos 35 suspeitos de agredir brasileiros |url=http://ultimosegundo.ig.com.br/mundo/2009/12/28/suriname+detidos+35+suspeitos+de+agredir+brasileiros+9257980.html |accessdate=December 28, 2009 |date=December 28, 2009 |publisher=iG |language=Portuguese |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120229033807/http://ultimosegundo.ig.com.br/mundo/2009/12/28/suriname%2Bdetidos%2B35%2Bsuspeitos%2Bde%2Bagredir%2Bbrasileiros%2B9257980.html |archivedate=February 29, 2012 |df= }}</ref> On December 28, an airplane with capacity for 40 people was sent to the city with the purpose of rescuing more Brazilians.<ref name="Suriname: detidos 35 suspeitos de agredir brasileiros"/>

''canadiense-mexicanos'' |image= Inmigración canadiense en México DF. (2).JPG |image_caption= Canadian relationships with Mexico. |population= '''14,488''' Canadian nationals residing in Mexico (2017){{cite web|title=Table 1: Total migrant stock at mid-year by origin and by major area, region, country or area of destination, 2017|url=http://www.un.org/en/development/desa/population/migration/data/estimates2/data/UN_MigrantStockByOriginAndDestination_2017.xlsx|publisher=United Nations, Department of Economic and Social Affairs, Population Division |accessdate=17 August 2018}} Unknown number of Mexicans of Canadian descent |regions= [[Mexico City]], [[Huatulco]], [[Guadalajara]] |langs= [[Mexican Spanish]]{{·}}[[Canadian English]]{{·}}[[Canadian French]] |rels= [[Roman Catholicism]]{{·}}[[Protestantism]]{{·}}[[Religion in Canada|Others]] |related= [[Canadian diaspora]] }} '''Canadians in Mexico''' consist mainly of working professionals and retired expatriates. According to Canada's [[Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade]], there are about 6,000 Canadians living in [[Mexico]], but only 3,000 are registered with the Canadian Embassy in [[Mexico City]]."[http://www.asiapacific.ca/sites/default/files/canadians_abroad_final.pdf Canadians Abroad: Canada's Global Asset]", ''Asia Pacific Foundation of Canada'', 26 July 2011."[http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/story/2010/01/13/montreal-haiti-canada-support.html Canadian toll in Haiti quake rises to 3]", ''CBC News'', 13 January 2010. According to statistics from Mexico's [[INEGI|National Institute of Statistics and Geography]], in 2009 there were 10,869 Canadian-born persons living in Mexico.{{cite web|title=Extranjeros Residentes En México |url=http://www.inm.gob.mx/estadisticas/Estimacion_de_Poblacion/2009/ExtranjerosResMex.pdf |publisher=[[Instituto Nacional de Migración]] |page=35 |accessdate=28 April 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924014742/http://www.inm.gob.mx/estadisticas/Estimacion_de_Poblacion/2009/ExtranjerosResMex.pdf |archivedate=24 September 2015 |df= }} An important Canadian-descended group is the [[Plautdietsch]]-speaking [[Russian Mennonites|"Russian" Mennonites]] and their descendants, who emigrated from Canada to Mexico starting in 1922. ==Mennonite immigration== [[File:CUAUHTEMOC4.jpg|thumbnail|left|Mennonite family in [[Cuauhtémoc, Chihuahua]]]] Today there are about 100,000 [[Mennonites in Mexico|Mennonites living in Mexico]], whose ancestors arrived via Canada. Migration to Mexico took place mainly in the years 1922 to 1927, smaller groups came after [[World War II]]. The first settlers moved to the [[Chihuahua (state)|State of Chihuahua]] (near [[Cuauhtemoc, Chihuahua|Cuauhtemoc]]) and [[Durango]] (near [[Nuevo Ideal]]). Later daughter-settlements in other states were established ([[San Luis Potosí]], [[Sinaloa]], [[Sonora]], [[Zacatecas]], [[Campeche]], [[Quintana Roo]] and [[Tamaulipas]]). ==Notable individuals== Notable Mexicans of Canadian origin include the artist [[Arnold Belkin]], cinematographer [[Alex Phillips]] and the actress [[Fannie Kauffman]]. ==See also== {{Portal|Mexico|Canada}} * [[Canada–Mexico relations]] * [[Mexican Canadian]] * [[American Mexican]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Canadians abroad}} {{Ethnic groups in Mexico}} [[Category:Immigration to Mexico]] [[Category:Canadian diaspora|Mexico]] [[Category:Mexican people of Canadian descent| ]] [[Category:Ethnic groups in Mexico]] [[Category:Canada–Mexico relations]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2016}} {{Use British English|date=October 2016}} {{Infobox academic |name = Caroline Skeel |image = Caroline_Anne_James_Skeel.jpg |image_size = |caption = Skeel in 1919 |alt = |birth_name = Caroline Anne James Skeel |birth_date = {{birth date|1872|2|9|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Hampstead]], England |death_date = {{death date and age|1951|2|25|1872|2|9|df=y}} |death_place = [[Hendon]], England |occupation = Historian |discipline = History |education = {{plainlist| * [[Notting Hill High School]] * [[Girton College, Cambridge]] }} |workplaces = [[Westfield College]] }} '''Caroline Anne James Skeel''' (9 February 1872 – 25 February 1951) was a British historian. She was a professor of history at [[Westfield College]], and is remembered for her work in Welsh social and economic history. The library at Westfield was named after her in 1971.
==Early years and education== Skeel was born in [[Hampstead]], London, the sixth of the seven children of William James Skeel (1822–1899), a physician and wealthy investor,<ref>{{cite book|title=The Carmarthenshire Historian|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=0AgXAQAAIAAJ|volume=6–13|year=1969|page=8}}</ref> and Anne (1831–1895). Both parents came from [[Pembrokeshire]], Wales – her father being from Castle Hill in the parish of [[Haycastle]], and her mother's parents came from [[Clarbeston]]. Skeel studied at a private school, and spent three years in South Hampstead High School and [[Notting Hill High School]] between 1884 and 1890. With 12 others from Notting Hill High School, she studied at [[Girton College, Cambridge]], having entered in 1891.{{sfn|Hodgson|1912|p=286}} At Girton, she was a St. Dunstan's Exhibitioner, and graduated with a first in both classics and history. A successful student, she was given the [[Agnata Butler Prize]] in 1893 and 1894, and the Thérèsa Montefiore Memorial Prize in her last year at Girton in 1895.<ref name="DWB">{{cite web|url=http://yba.llgc.org.uk/en/s2-SKEE-JAM-1872.html|title=Skeel, Caroline Anne James|publisher=Dictionary of Welsh Biography, The National Library of Wales|accessdate=7 March 2016}}</ref>
In 1926 she was awarded an [[Master of Arts (Oxbridge and Dublin)|M.A. (Cantab)]] degree.<ref name="DWB"/>
==Career== After graduating from Girton, Skeel was appointed as a history teacher at [[Westfield College]], London. While teaching there she published her first work, ''Travel in the First Century A.D.'', in 1901.<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=xoI9AAAAIAAJ&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage|title=Travel in the First Century After Christ: With special reference to Asia Minor|first=Caroline A. J.|last=Skeel|year=1901|publisher=Cambridge University Press}}</ref> She became known for her research into Welsh history, of which her ''The Council in the Marches of Wales: A study in local government in the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries'' (1904) was notable. Much of her research delved into aspects of Welsh social and economic history which were poorly covered at the time.<ref name="DWB"/>
Skeel assumed responsibility for the college's library beginning in 1902.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.library.qmul.ac.uk/archives/visit|title=Arranging Your Visit|publisher=[[Queen Mary University of London]]|accessdate=10 April 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100712013033/http://www.library.qmul.ac.uk/archives/visit|archivedate=12 July 2010|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 1907, she fell into ill health and was absent from Westfield for a period but after her return, she took over as Head of Department from 1911 to 1919.<ref name="DWB"/> She was Reader and Head of Department from 1919 to 1925 and University Professor of history from 1925 to 1929. In 1924, she published an article on the [[Wool industry of Wales]], and contributed a chapter to a book on Wales under [[Henry VII of England|Henry VII]] by [[Robert William Seton-Watson|R. W. Seton-Watson]].<ref name="DWB"/> In 1926 she submitted ''The Cattle Trade Between England and Wales in the 15th to 18th Centuries'' to the [[Royal Historical Society]].<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=dQ9OAAAAMAAJ&q=caroline+skeel|title=Wales and the Drovers|first=Philip Gwyn |last=Hughes|publisher=Golden Grove Editions|year=1988|page=24}} (footnote 1)</ref>
==Memberships== Skeel was a Fellow of the Royal Historical Society from 1914 to 1928, serving on its Council and Publications Committee from 1921 to 1927. She was a member of the [[Classical Association]], the [[Historical Association]], and the [[Cymmrodorion Society]].<ref name="DWB"/>
==Awards and honors== In 1914 she was a recipient of the Henry Hutchison Medal, and the Gamble Prize for producing an essay on the works of [[John William Fortescue|Sir John Fortesque]].<ref name="DWB"/>
==Later life and legacy== She retired in 1929 to 34 Heald Crescent in [[Hendon]], where, despite her significant wealth, she lived modestly. She died in February 1951, leaving an estate worth £269,386, of which a large sum was bequeathed to numerous Christian charities and Westfield College.<ref name="DWB"/>
The library at Westfield (currently the [[Queen Mary University of London]]) was named the Caroline Skeel Library when it was established in 1971.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.aim25.ac.uk/cgi-bin/vcdf/detail?coll_id=3044&inst_id=39|title=Westfield College|publisher=[[AIM25]]|date=September 2010|accessdate=8 March 2016}}</ref>
==References== ===Notes=== {{reflist|30em}}

{{Italic title}} The '''''commedia sexy all'italiana''''' (lit. "sex comedy Italian style"), also known as ''commedia scollacciata'' or ''commedia erotica all'italiana,'' is a subgenre of Italian ''[[commedia all'italiana]]'' [[film genre]].
==Style== ''Commedia sexy'' is characterized typically by abundant female nudity, and by the minimal weight given to social criticism that was instead basic in the ''commedia all'italiana'' main genre,<ref name=gener>{{cite book|last=Peter E. Bondanella|title=A history of Italian cinema|publisher=Continuum International Publishing Group, 2009|isbn=978-1441160690}}</ref> and stories are often set in affluent environments such as wealthy households. The genre has been described as a cross between [[Sex comedy|bawdy comedy]] and humorous [[softcore porn|erotic film]] with ample [[slapstick]] elements and follows more or less clichéd storylines.
==History== This subgenre has its roots in several different series of films. The "[[mondo film]]" genre popularized nudity, shifting the limits of what could be shown in the Italian cinema. A series of successful "Italian style comedies" of the sixties (such as [[Pietro Germi]]'s ''[[Signore & Signori]]'' (1966) and [[Dino Risi]]'s ''[[Vedo nudo]]'' (1969)) focused on Italian hypocrisy and shame about sexual taboos, popularizing sex-based plots. [[Pier Paolo Pasolini]]'s "trilogy of life" (''[[The Decameron (1971 film)|The Decameron]]'' (1971), ''[[The Canterbury Tales (film)|Canterbury Tales]]'' (1972) and ''[[Arabian Nights (1974 film)|Arabian Nights]]'' (1974)), clearly inspired by Boccaccio and Chaucer's tales, contained both nudity and sex-based plots, and was successful enough to generate a number of unofficial sequels and spoofs that became collectively known as ''Decamerotici''.<ref name=gener/><ref name=whu>{{cite book|last=Michele Giordano, Daniele Aramu|title=La commedia erotica italiana|publisher=Gremese Editore, 2000|isbn=888440035X}}</ref> These spoofs can be considered the first ''commedia sexy'' films. The relaxation of Italian censors, beginning from the early '70s, paved the way for dozens of soft-core productions, often set in medieval or Renaissance times, even in prehistory, or peasant and rustic environments ("film pecorecci").
The ''commedia sexy'' was very successful commercially between the 1970s and early 1980s, although it was generally panned by critics (with a few exceptions such as several comedies starring [[Lando Buzzanca]]), and then declined when female nudity became common in Italian mainstream cinema, television and magazines, and when [[pornographic film]]s became more widely available.<ref name=gener/>
==Actors== The ''commedia sexy'' launched the career of several actresses, including [[Edwige Fenech]], commonly considered the star of the genre; [[Gloria Guida]], the staple lead actress of [[coming-of-age story|coming-of-age]] films and the popular ''La liceale'' series in the mid-1970s; and [[Nadia Cassini]] who was publicised as an heiress to Fenech in the late 1970s. Many actresses who had earlier success in other genres were seen passing to ''commedia sexy'' and becoming well-known exponents, such as [[Femi Benussi]] in the mid-1970s, [[Barbara Bouchet]] in the late 1970s, and [[glamour models]] [[Anna Maria Rizzoli]] and [[Carmen Russo]] in the early 1980s, a period when the genre was starting to fade in popularity.
The genre is also effectively identified with prominent male comedians including [[Lino Banfi]], [[Pippo Franco]], [[Alvaro Vitali]], and [[Renzo Montagnani]].<ref name=gener/><ref name=whu/>
